question_content.barrons:question: Seemingly solid at first, Napoleon’s 1807 alliance with Russia quickly proved __________: it disintegrated altogether in 1812.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
tenuous, indissoluble.

Something tenuous is by definition weak or flimsy. Something shaky is by definition insecure or unstable. A tenuous (flimsy) or shaky (unstable) alliance would be likely to disintegrate. Note also the use of the adverb seemingly to cast doubt on just how solid Napoleon’s 1807 alliance with Russia actually was.

Autocratic is incorrect. Something autocratic is by definition dictatorial or despotic. The adjective makes no sense in the context.

Salubrious is incorrect. Something salubrious is by definition healthful or beneficial. The adjective makes no sense in the context.

Indissoluble is incorrect. One would not describe an alliance that disintegrated within five years to be indissoluble (firm; perpetually binding).

Viable is incorrect. Once would not describe an alliance that disintegrates within five years as viable (workable; capable of success).
